## Table for Each Day of EOS Transects 
```{r readData, echo=FALSE}
sumaug13 <- read.csv(here("Picarro/EOSTransects/081319/summethaneaug13.csv"))
sumjuly17 <- read.csv(here("Picarro/EOSTransects/071619/summethanejuly17.csv"))
sumjuly23 <- read.csv(here("Picarro/EOSTransects/072219/summethanejuly23.csv"))
sumjuly30 <- read.csv(here("Picarro/EOSTransects/072919/summethanejuly30.csv"))
sumaug02 <- read.csv(here("Picarro/EOSTransects/080119/summethaneaug02.csv"))
sumaug09 <- read.csv(here("Picarro/EOSTransects/080819/summethaneaug09.csv"))

sumaug13$day <- as.character("Aug13")
sumjuly17$day <- as.character("July17")
sumjuly23$day <- as.character("July23")
sumjuly30$day <- as.character("July30")
sumaug02$day <- as.character("Aug02")
sumaug09$day <- as.character("Aug09")

sumalltransects <- rbind(sumaug13, sumjuly17, sumjuly23, sumjuly30, sumaug02, sumaug09)

sumaug13 <- sumaug13 %>%
  select(Sample, Avg_iCH4, StdDev_iCH4)
sumaug02 <- sumaug02 %>%
  select(Sample, Avg_iCH4, StdDev_iCH4)
sumaug09 <- sumaug09 %>%
  select(Sample, Avg_iCH4, StdDev_iCH4)
sumjuly17 <- sumjuly17 %>%
  select(Sample, Avg_iCH4, StdDev_iCH4)
sumjuly23 <- sumjuly23 %>%
  select(Sample, Avg_iCH4, StdDev_iCH4)
sumjuly30 <- sumjuly30 %>%
  select(Sample, Avg_iCH4, StdDev_iCH4)
sumjuly17 <- sumjuly17[c(1:9), ]

```

## All Delta_iCH4 Values 
```{r , eval=TRUE, warning=FALSE, echo=FALSE, fig.width = 20, fig.height= 15}

#try doing it all together instead 

pbetter2 <- ggplot(sumalltransects, aes(x= Sample, y= Avg_iCH4, color=day))+
  geom_point(size=8)+
  xlab('Collar') +
  ylab('Delta_Avg') +
  ylim(-55, -40)+
  ggtitle("EOS Delta i_CH4 Summary") +
  scale_color_manual(values=wes_palette("Zissou1", n=6, type = c("continuous")))+
  theme(legend.position = "right")
pbetter2

```
Here, the raw delta_iCH4 value is used, but we have many options for this including raw HR, raw HP, 30s, etc. What is best?
